Liquidnet Seeks a Buyer Amid Slower M&A Deals ...  Chase (Ticker: JPM) is advising on the Liquidnet sale, a person familiar with the process said. The company is seeking $1 billion with bids due this month, Bloomberg reported . Marisha Mistry, a spokeswoman for Liquidnet, declined to comment. JPMorgan also declined to comment. Interested bidders will likely include Broadridge Financial Solutions (BR), SS&C Technologies Holdings , (SSNC) Fidelity National Information Services (FIS), State Street (STT) and Bank of New York (BK), according to bankers and private equity executives. State Street declined to comment, and spokespersons for the other companies couldn't be reached for comment. Seth Merrin founded Liquidnet in 1999 and is its majority owner. The New York company is known for operating so-called ...

Wall Street bankers keep busy with stock sales ... the heath-care industry on record, according to data compiled by Bloomberg. Sanofi's move came a few weeks after the pandemic's first big deal of this kind, PNC Financial Services Group Inc's sale of its quarter-century-old stake of more than $13bn in BlackRock Inc. The sale was the second-largest equity offering in the US since Alibaba Group Holding ...  Ltd's $25bn IPO in 2014, according to data compiled by Bloomberg. PNC's BlackRock stake was picked up by existing investors including Wellington Management, Capital Group Cos and Fidelity Investments, according to people familiar with the matter. At least four state investment vehicles from the Middle East also took part in the offering, the people said. More such sales are coming.  ...

Getty Coronavirus Crisis Mobile Banking Surge is a Shift That's Likely to Stick April saw a 200% jump in new mobile banking registrations, while mobile banking traffic rose 85%, according to Fidelity National Information Services. The coronavirus lockdown resulted in many bank branches being closed, as well as Americans checking their accounts repeatedly for their stimulus payout. Another survey showed only 40% of respondents said they expect to return to branches post-Covid, indicating the shift to online is likely to stick.
